property.name: Include in build
property.description: Select 'Yes' to include this file in the build.

property.name: Primitives
property.description: Select 'Yes' for primitives to be shown in debug output.

property.name: Timestamps
property.description: Select 'Yes' for timestamps to be shown in debug output.

property.name: Characters
property.description: Select 'Yes' for characters to be shown in debug output.

property.name: Messages
property.description: Select 'Yes' for messages to be shown in debug output.

property.name: Heap allocations
property.description: Select 'Yes' for the PC value to be displayed.

property.name: Fault Alerts
property.description: Select 'Yes' for faults from the firmware to be displayed.

property.name: Output name
property.description:
Specify the name that you want to give the output file.

If you leave this blank, then the project name will be used.

property.name: Execution mode
property.description:
Specify the execution mode for this application.
VM mode is the traditional virtual machine from BlueLab3.
Native mode is faster and supports more than 64Kw of code, but applications are typically over 50% larger than when built in VM mode.
Assisted Native mode is a hardware assisted version of Native mode available on some BlueCore ICs. Assisted native offers the benefits of native execution with reduced application size overhead compared to Native mode.
Hardware Default will select the most appropriate mode for the Hardware you have specified or can be detected. If this option is selected and no hardware is connected, the default, Assisted Native, shall be used.

property.name: Stack size
property.description: Specify the size of stack that the application requires. If set to 0, this value will be automatically calculated.

property.name: Transport
property.description: Select the host transport to configure in the persistent store. This is set whenever programming the application and firmware into your device.

property.name: Firmware
property.description:
Specify the firmware variant to use.
Unified firmware can be used as RFComm or HCI based on the setting of ONCHIP_HCI_CLIENT PS Key.
Compact firmware is unified without a loader, suitable for prototyping ROM parts.

property.name: BlueCore hardware
property.description:
Specify the method used to set the BlueCore variant that will be targeted by the tool chain.

"Query chip" results in BlueLab automatically detecting the BlueCore variant that is currently connected. If no chip is connected the tool chain will refuse to merge the VM application and the firmware.

Choosing a particular BlueCore will force the tool chain to build a merged application and firmware image that targets that BlueCore.

property.name: Flash/Rom size
property.description:
Specify the method used to detect the flash/rom size of the BlueCore variant that will be targeted by the tool chain.

"Query chip" results in BlueLab automatically detecting the flash/rom size of the BlueCore variant that is currently connected. If no chip is connected the tool chain will refuse to merge the VM application and the firmware.

Choosing a particular size will force the tool chain to build a merged application and firmware image that targets a BlueCore with that flash/rom size.

property.name: Build merge
property.description: Select 'Yes' to generate merge.xdv/xpv images on Build.

property.name: Storage type
property.description: Specify the storage type used by the chip. Used to select the firmware that is programmed to the chip.

property.name: Panic action
property.description: Specify what the firmware should do if this application panics when xIDE is not running.

property.name: Define symbols
property.description:
Specify preprocessor symbols to define. These are passed to GCC using the -D command line option.

Multiple symbols can be separated with a comma.

property.name: Libraries
property.description:
Specify the libraries to be used in the project. These are passed to GCC using the -l command line option.

Multiple libraries can be separated with a comma.

property.name: SQIF Partitions
property.description:
Specify the image directories for SQIF Partitions.

Multiple directories can be separated with a comma.

property.name: Firmware Image
property.description: A custom firmware path can be set here. Enter the full path to the firmware, without the .xpv/.xdv/.xuv extension. Leave blank to use the default BlueLab firmware.

property.name: Library Version
property.description: Which version of the libraries is being used. Set this to use a custom version of the libraries; otherwise the default is BlueLabX.X (the release number of your BlueLab installation).

property.name: Generate map file
property.description: Generate linker map file?
